column9: ,Attachment 4: A Case Study On Transformation Of Farmers Clubs To Producer Organization In Bilaspur District, Chhattisgarh State,Attachment 5: Indicative Framework Of The Process Of Forming A Producer Organization The Following Framework Is Created By Prof. Amar Kjr Nayak Of Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy Of Administration, Mussoorie Keeping In View The Sustainability Of A Producer Organisation.",,,,,179,input/md/english/FARMER PRODUCER ORGANISATIONS.pdf,table,,"This case study outlines the process of transforming farmers clubs into producer organizations in Bilaspur District, Chhattisgarh State. It involves activities such as identifying the community/cluster, conducting baseline surveys, mapping village resources, and converging basic social and community health services. The development of local organizational and institutional structures is crucial, including seeking membership/ownership by farmer/producer members and identifying potential local people for professional training. Building trust, cooperation, and community spirit through organizing people at the village and cluster levels is also emphasized. The framework aims to ensure the sustainability of the producer organization."

column1: 363,268,"Identify village volunteers, potential community leaders, retired teachers, etc. for deeper engagements. Build awareness on the virtues of communitarian spirit for sustainability of the community. Share the idea of community identity and togetherness to solve the common problems of the community like community health, education, agricultural production, marketing, common resources or external resources. Share all issues and develop plans for the community through participation. Gradually build trust and cooperation among the small farmers/producers in the villages and the whole cluster/community. Share the idea of forming a single institutional platform at the cluster level or the CES for resolving the various production, value addition, marketing issues and for better net income realization for the labour of the producers. Create a platform for dialogue between different social groups and interest groups in the cluster/GP/community.  5  Facilitate Community Health and Primary Education Develop a network of midwives in every village and link them through the PO to a network of doctors for consultation and advice. Converge with local government support for a mobile van, paying fuel expenses to cater to the health needs of the community. Network with doctors and pharmaceutical companies for medicine. Develop a holistic healthcare facility for the community.","Attachment 4: A Case Study On Transformation Of Farmers Clubs To Producer Organization In Bilaspur District, Chhattisgarh State,Attachment 5: Indicative Framework Of The Process Of Forming A Producer Organization The Following Framework Is Created By Prof. Amar Kjr Nayak Of Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy Of Administration, Mussoorie Keeping In View The Sustainability Of A Producer Organisation.",,,,,199,input/md/english/FARMER PRODUCER ORGANISATIONS.pdf,para,,"The process of transforming farmers clubs into producer organizations involves identifying potential community leaders and engaging them deeply. Building awareness about the benefits of community spirit and togetherness is crucial for sustainability. The idea of forming a single institutional platform at the cluster level is shared to resolve production, marketing, and income realization issues. Creating a platform for dialogue between different social and interest groups is emphasized. Additionally, facilitating community health and primary education through networks of midwives, doctors, and pharmaceutical companies is recommended."

364,268,"Identify qualified youth at village level to guide and teach children after school time in respective villages. Offer services for adult education through professionals of PO.Meeting hall & Drying yards for the farmers/producers at the village level. Village level facility for tutorials for children and for community health, improved cattle, kitchen gardens, fodder growth. Make the following provisions at the cluster/GP level: Small Office with basic record keeping facility. Storage facility of agricultural produce. Basic transport (1 pick-up van, 2 motor cycles, 2 cycles) Facility for local value addition. Small Nursery & Seed Bank  7  Develop Sustainable Market Networks Begin with marketing of the surplus produce. Select a mix of produce and not one produce. The selection will be based on economical volume and shelf life of the produce. Discover the price, intermediaries and the final set of buyers. Set up retail outlets in nearby towns and a marketing setup in the district/ state capital. Create organized marketing platforms at the village and local weekly haats. Develop a calendar for sales through various exhibitions organized by the state departments and district administration.","Attachment 4: A Case Study On Transformation Of Farmers Clubs To Producer Organization In Bilaspur District, Mussoorie Keeping In View The Sustainability Of A Producer Organisation.,6 Build Physical Infrastructure, Chhattisgarh State,Attachment 5: Indicative Framework Of The Process Of Forming A Producer Organization The Following Framework Is Created By Prof. Amar Kjr Nayak Of Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy Of Administration",,,,,183,input/md/english/FARMER PRODUCER ORGANISATIONS.pdf,para,,"The transformation of farmers clubs to producer organizations in Bilaspur District involves identifying qualified youth to guide and teach children, offering adult education services, and providing meeting halls and drying yards for farmers at the village level. At the cluster/GP level, provisions include a small office, storage facility, basic transport, local value addition, and a small nursery & seed bank. To develop sustainable market networks, the strategy involves marketing surplus produce, selecting a mix of produce based on volume and shelf life, discovering prices and intermediaries, setting up retail outlets, and creating organized marketing platforms at the village and local weekly haats. Additionally, a calendar for sales through various exhibitions organized by state departments and district administration is part of the plan."

column1: 366,271,"9  Provide Micro-credit Security and Community Banking Services Provide credit for emergencies arising out of sickness, education, etc. Provide production credit for agricultural and allied activities. Provide limited credit as consumption credit for children's wedding, festival, etc. Develop a community banking service. On behalf of the community, the PO can transact with the formal banking system.  10 Create and Support Local Retail to  cater for Local Consumption Needs Identify a family/SHG from each village to put up a village retail shop; wherever necessary. Provide financial credit to set up a retail shop in each village in the cluster, if necessary. Arrange for bulk supplies of items to the retail outlets established in the villages.  11 Develop Local Value Addition for:  Agricultural produce Horticultural produce Livestock/fisheries Forest produce Local art and craft products.  12 Introduce the System of Integrated  Agriculture Integrated agricultural system adopting low-cost agricultural practices. Train farmers about on-farm inputs. Enhance farm biomass generation. Identify successful local farmers to train them to be the trainers/experts to the community of producers.","Attachment 4: A Case Study On Transformation Of Farmers Clubs To Producer Organization In Bilaspur District, Chhattisgarh State,6 Build Physical Infrastructure",,,,,171,input/md/english/FARMER PRODUCER ORGANISATIONS.pdf,para,,"The producer organization should provide micro-credit security and community banking services, including credit for emergencies and production activities. It should also support local retail to cater for local consumption needs and develop local value addition for various agricultural and craft products. Additionally, the organization should introduce an integrated agricultural system adopting low-cost practices, train farmers about on-farm inputs, and identify successful local farmers to train and be experts for the community."

367,271," 13 Integrate Farm Activities with Other  Economic Activities Integrate farm activities with the various non-farm and allied activities in the community to realize maximum value for the labor put in by the marginal & small producers.  14 Converge Resources from the State  and Central Government schemes for an integrated and holistic development Converge livelihood schemes like NRLM, IAP and MGNREGS at the cluster level and PO. Converge health and education    programmes like NRHM and SSA to the PO. Improve the natural resources like forest, soil and water of the community by converging forest and watershed development at the cluster level and PO. Activate joint forest management practices and stop forest burning and excessive felling of trees. Converge the rural infrastructure such as road, bridges, electricity, public transport and telecommunication services at the cluster level. Activities of the various extension services of the government, PDS, horticulture, livestock, etc. can be converged at the PO for a cluster (GP).","Attachment 4: A Case Study On Transformation Of Farmers Clubs To Producer Organization In Bilaspur District, Chhattisgarh State,6 Build Physical Infrastructure",,,,,157,input/md/english/FARMER PRODUCER ORGANISATIONS.pdf,para,,"The integration of farm activities with non-farm and allied activities is essential to maximize the value of labor put in by small producers. It is important to converge resources from state and central government schemes for integrated and holistic development, including livelihood schemes, health and education programs, and natural resource improvement. Joint forest management practices should be activated to improve natural resources and prevent excessive felling of trees. Converging rural infrastructure such as roads, bridges, electricity, and public transport at the cluster level is crucial. Additionally, activities of various government extension services can be converged at the Producer Organization for a cluster."

368,408,"Champion As the sustainable community enterprise system (Producer Organization) takes root in the community, the external champion needs to gradually withdraw from Year 5 and completely by Year 7. During the first 2 years, the external institutional champion should animate the cooperative movement and then gradually be replaced by local facilitators of the PO."

column4: ,Attachment 4: A Case Study On Transformation Of Farmers Clubs To Producer Organization In Bilaspur District, Chhattisgarh State,Risk Factors And Indicators /Measures For Verification In The Above Flow Chart",,,,,253,input/md/english/FARMER PRODUCER ORGANISATIONS.pdf,table,,"This case study outlines the verification activities for the transformation of farmers' clubs to producer organizations, including baseline surveys, convergence of basic services, and development of local organizational structures. It emphasizes building trust and cooperation at the village and cluster levels, as well as facilitating community health and primary education. The study also focuses on developing sustainable market networks, tying up for working capital, and providing micro-credit security and community banking services. Additionally, it highlights the creation and support of local retail for consumption needs, local value addition for various produce, and the integration of farm activities with other economic activities."

Lack of networking skills / abilities to convince various Govt.","Attachment 4: A Case Study On Transformation Of Farmers Clubs To Producer Organization In Bilaspur District, Chhattisgarh State,Risk Factors And Indicators /Measures For Verification In The Above Flow Chart",,,,,184,input/md/english/FARMER PRODUCER ORGANISATIONS.pdf,para,,"The transformation of farmers clubs to producer organizations in Bilaspur District, Chhattisgarh State faces several risk factors including unrealistic assumptions in baseline survey, lack of trust among various people in the community, non-availability of suitable market conditions, and delays in getting working capital. Other challenges include non-participation from local people, lack of capital and government support, non-availability of health and education services, and lack of communitarian spirit and willingness to save. The process also involves converging resources from state and central government schemes for integrated development, and the withdrawal process of the external champion for the development of local youth to take over PO functions. Additionally, there is a lack of understanding or trust on market information for value addition, integrated farming, and other economic activities, as well as a lack of networking skills and abilities to convince various government entities."

378,419,"The POPI will identify potential groups/ farmer clusters such as successful watersheds, wadi projects and their Federations, Farmers Clubs, Farmers' Cooperatives, Self Help Groups, Joint Liability Groups, Farmers Interest Groups or their federations, etc. and define appropriate geographies to form FPOs. As far as possible the interest groups which have already been financed by a bank branch, may be considered for federating into one FPO. Thereafter, the POPI will focus on social mobilisation, awareness creation and motivating them to form FPO. A baseline survey will be conducted by POPI for bench marking, Training Need Assessment of the producers, assessing infrastructure requirements, market intervention and other support facilities/linkages necessary for the success of FPO. This will be followed by designing and organising capacity building programmes, preparation of business development plan for the FPOs, establishment and registration under appropriate Act, facilitation in credit and market linkages and extending hand-holding support towards maturity for a minimum period of 03 years.","(On Stamp Paper Of Appropriate Value As Per The Respective State Law) Memorandum Of Agreement,I. Role Of Producer Organization Promoting Institutions (Popis) (A) Overall Requirement",,,,,157,input/md/english/FARMER PRODUCER ORGANISATIONS.pdf,para,,"The POPI will identify potential groups/farmer clusters and define appropriate geographies to form FPOs, focusing on social mobilization and awareness creation. A baseline survey will be conducted for benchmarking, Training Need Assessment, infrastructure requirements, market intervention, and other support facilities. Capacity building programs will be designed and organized, along with the preparation of business development plans for the FPOs. The POPI will also facilitate in credit and market linkages and provide hand-holding support for a minimum period of 03 years to ensure maturity."

385,283,"If the dispute has not resolved amicably within fifteen days (15 days) after one Party has served written notice on the other Party requesting the commencement of such discussions, either party may in writing demand that the dispute be finally settled by the arbitration in accordance with Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. The sole arbitrator shall be appointed by NABARD in case of dispute raised by NABARD, from the panel of three persons nominated by POPI. Similarly, the sole arbitrator shall be appointed by POPI if dispute is raised by POPI  from the panel of three persons nominated by NABARD. The language of the Arbitration shall be English and the arbitrator shall be fluent in English. The arbitrator should be person of repute and integrity and place of arbitration shall be Mumbai.""   10.
